io.mpos.provider
Interface Provider

All Known Subinterfaces:
ProviderWithServerSubsystem
public interface Provider

The payment provider is the main instance responsible for handling, creating, and managing transactions and the connection to external accessories.

Since:
2.0.0

Method Summary

          Attempts to abort a transaction.

Returns the mode the provider is configured in.

Returns:
The provider mode

shutdown

void shutdown()
Closes all active connections and frees all occupied resources. This should be called within your onDestroy() method

Since:
2.0.0

Returns a collection containing all accessories that are currently handled by the provider (either connected/disconnected/not in range).

connectToAccessory

void connectToAccessory(AccessoryOptions options)
                        throws MposRuntimeException
Connects to an accessory with the given options.

Parameters:
options - The options to be used for the connection effort
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the options are invalid
Since:
2.0.0

checkUpdateRequirementForAccessory

void checkUpdateRequirementForAccessory(Accessory accessory)
                                        throws MposRuntimeException
Checks if an update for the given accessory is available and must be installed before a transaction can take place.

Parameters:
accessory - The accessory to check
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the accessory is invalid
Since:
2.0.0

updateAccessory

void updateAccessory(Accessory accessory)
Updates the accessory configuration/software.

Parameters:
accessory - The accessory to update
Since:
2.0.0

updateAccessoryState

void updateAccessoryState(Accessory accessory)
Updates the accessory state.

The accessory will have its details updated, as well as the battery state and level. The @{link AccessoryComponentListener#onAccessoryBatteryEvent} is called for all registered AccessoryComponentListeners with the updated values.

Parameters:
accessory - The accessory that should update its state.
Since:
2.1.0

disconnectFromAccessory

void disconnectFromAccessory(Accessory accessory)
                             throws MposRuntimeException
Disconnects a given accessory. This is normally required if more than once accessory using the Bluetooth connection consecutively (e.g. fist a PED and then a printer). Also note that the accessory reference is no longer valid for interactions and transactions, but rather only given back as a reference.

Parameters:
accessory - The accessory to disconnect from
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the accessory is invalid
Since:
2.0.0

lookupTransactionWithIdentifier

void lookupTransactionWithIdentifier(java.lang.String mobileIdentifier)
                                     throws MposRuntimeException
Looks up a previous transaction (including state), typically when the transaction failed due to network errors.

Parameters:
mobileIdentifier - The reference to the transaction
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the identifier is invalid
Since:
2.0.0

startTransaction

@Deprecated
void startTransaction(Transaction transaction,
                                 PaymentDetailsScheme[] schemePreference,
                                 Accessory accessory)
                      throws MposRuntimeException
Deprecated. As of release 2.2, replaced by @{link #startTransaction(Transaction transaction, Accessory accessory}.

Throws:
MposRuntimeException

startTransaction

void startTransaction(Transaction transaction,
                      Accessory accessory)
                      throws MposRuntimeException
Starts registering and executing a given transaction with the help of the given accessory. From there on action callbacks will request additional parameters if necessary. This request typically starts a mPOS transaction

Parameters:
transaction - The transaction to be executed
accessory - The accessory to use for the transaction
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the transaction is invalid
Since:
2.2

continueTransaction

void continueTransaction(Transaction transaction,
                         TransactionAction action,
                         TransactionActionResponse data)
                         throws MposRuntimeException
Continues a transaction for a given action request, providing additional data if needed. Note that callbacks are still handled by the failure listener you handed to startTransaction

Parameters:
transaction - The transaction to continue
action - The action you respond to
data - Response data provided for the specific action (e.g. containing a signature)
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the transaction is invalid
Since:
2.0.0

abortTransaction

void abortTransaction(Transaction transaction)
                      throws MposRuntimeException
Attempts to abort a transaction. This is only possible in selected states (registered, accessoryWorkflow)

Parameters:
transaction - The transaction to abort
Throws:
MposRuntimeException - If the transaction is invalid
Since:
2.0.0

addTransactionListener

void addTransactionListener(TransactionListener transactionListener)
Adds a listener that will be informed on events concerning transactions.

If there have been events while no listener was registered, those events will be sent to the new listener.

Parameters:
transactionListener - The listener to be registered. Must not be null.
Since:
2.0.0

removeTransactionListener

void removeTransactionListener(TransactionListener transactionListener)
Removes the listener

Parameters:
transactionListener - The listener to be removed
Since:
2.0.0

addTransactionRegisterListener

void addTransactionRegisterListener(TransactionRegisterListener transactionRegisterListener)
Adds a listener that will be informed on events concerning manual registration of transactions.

If there have been events while no listener was registered, those events will be sent to the new listener.

Parameters:
transactionRegisterListener - The listener to be registered. Must not be null.
Since:
2.0.0

2.0.0

Parameters:

Since:
2.0.0

addAccessoryComponentListener

void addAccessoryComponentListener(AccessoryComponentListener accessoryComponentListener)
Adds a listener that will be informed as soon as components of an accessories change their state. Processing of those events are optional and not mandatory for a successful transaction processing.

The class DefaultProviderComponentListener provides an convenient * implementation where a listener can derive from.

Parameters:
accessoryComponentListener - The listener to be registered. Must not be null.
Since:
2.0.0

removeAccessoryComponentListener

void removeAccessoryComponentListener(AccessoryComponentListener accessoryComponentListener)
Removes the registered listener.

Parameters:
accessoryComponentListener - The listener to be removed.
Since:
2.0.0

addProviderComponentListener

void addProviderComponentListener(ProviderComponentListener providerComponentListener)
Adds a listener that will be informed as soon as accessories or transactions change their state. Processing of those events are optional and not mandatory for a successful transaction processing.

The class DefaultProviderComponentListener provides an convenient * implementation where a listener can derive from.

Parameters:
providerComponentListener - The listener to be registered. Must not be null.
Since:
2.0.0

removeProviderComponentListener

void removeProviderComponentListener(ProviderComponentListener providerComponentListener)
Removes the registered listener.

Parameters:
providerComponentListener - The listener to be removed.
Since:
2.0.0
